strings.string: Step-by-Step Intro
1. Make a new program
Tap on "New".
Enter a progam name, select "Create empty program" and tap "OK".
2. Create a new object
Tap:
Choose the source of the first look of your new object.
Draw a new look.
Choose from gallery.
Take a picture.
Enter an object name and tap “OK” to create the object.
3. Start Moving
Tap:
The first brick we use is out of the category "Motion".
Choose the "Glide" brick. The object will move to the new position defined with the brick on the stage.
Tap “Play” to go to the stage and see the object gliding.
Use the Android Back Button to get back from the stage.
4. Change Look
You can change the look of your object.
Choose the “Switch to look” brick. With this brick you can choose a look or create a new one.
Snap the brick underneath the others.
Tap into the dropdown field to create a new look.
Choose the source of the image like before.
Now you have to select the new image.
Tap play to see the behaviour on the stage.
5. Speak
Now you will find out how to make an object talk.
Choose the “Speak” brick. The object speaks the text, when this brick is executed.
Snap the brick underneath the "Switch to look" brick.
Tap play to see the behaviour on the stage.
6. Again and again
This step shows you how to repeat behaviour of objects.
Choose the “Forever” brick. Everything in the loop repeats forever.
Snap the “Forever” brick underneath the first brick.
Add another “Glide” brick.
Snap the “Glide” brick aboth the “End of loop” brick.
Tap into the text field of the x and y value and set to 0.
Tap play to see the behaviour on the stage.
7. Copy, delete or edit a brick.
You can also control the behaviour of the object when the program is running on the stage.
Choose the “When tapped” brick. Every brick underneath the “When tapped” will be executed one time when you tap the object on the stage.
Place the “When tapped” underneath the other bricks.
Choose the “Turn right” brick and snap it underneath the “When tapped” brick.
Now you have this script.
Tap play to see the behaviour on the stage.
8. Copy, delete or edit a brick
Single tap on the left side of each brick opens the context menu. There you can move, copy, delete or edit the values of the brick with the formula editor.
